newsitem.title: USA: CME lumber down near limit on weak cash,technicals.
newsitem.headline: CME lumber down near limit on weak cash,technicals.

text.p: Continued pressure from weaker cash lumber prices pushed CME lumber futures down to technical selling and prices fell for near limit losses on sell stops, traders said.
July fell $9.60 per thousand board feet to $375.00 and September tumbled $9.70 to $365.80 before finding support. Futures are currently $9.00 to $1.50 lower with July off $8.60 at $376.00.
Reports of slow cash lumber business and increased product offerings have weighed on the markets since midweek, sources said.

Traders said the U.S. House appropriations committee's passage of a spending bill Thursday that included a timber harvest of 3.8 billion board feet from federal forests had no effect as the amount had been expected.
